intro: Phyllorkis falcata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed phyllorkis, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and heathlands. Phyllorkis falcata is well adapted to the dry and sunny conditions of its natural habitat.
